title: Member Preview: Van Gogh and the Avant-Garde—The Modern Landscape (May 12–13)
title_display: Member Preview: Van Gogh and the Avant-Garde—The Modern Landscape
hero_caption: Vincent van Gogh. The Bridge at Courbevoie, 1887. Van Gogh Museum, Amsterdam (Vincent van Gogh Foundation).
short_description: Enjoy a full day of member-only access to Van Gogh and the Avant-Garde: The Modern Landscape, and see the exhibition before it opens to the public.
list_description: Enjoy a full day of member-only access to Van Gogh and the Avant-Garde: The Modern Landscape, and see the exhibition before it opens to the public.
description:
Members enjoy three full days of exclusive access to Van Gogh and the Avant-Garde: The Modern Landscape.

Bringing together more than 75 paintings and drawings, this exhibition follows five interconnected artists—Vincent van Gogh, Georges Seurat, Paul Signac, Émile Bernard, and Charles Angrand—as they retreated to the working-class suburbs of Paris in the 1880s and found there an evolving industrial and social landscape that fueled intense creativity and experimentation.

Visit May 11–13 to see this highly anticipated show before it opens to the public. Simply show your member card or digital member card to enter.

See more member programs.

Please note that this is an in-person event that takes place at the museum. In accordance with state and City of Chicago guidelines, visitors to the museum are no longer required to wear masks or provide proof of vaccination, though anyone who would like to wear a mask is encouraged to do so. If you are experiencing COVID-19 symptoms or have been exposed to COVID-19 in the week before your visit, we ask that you stay home. We appreciate your help in keeping the museum a healthy and safe place for our staff and visitors. Learn more about our visiting policies.

If you have any questions about programming, please reach out to museum-programs@artic.edu.
